trans-unit.source: Represents an X.509 token used as the signing credential.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SigningCredentials"></xref> class based on the specified X.509 certificate.
By default, this constructor uses an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause> to generate the security key identifier.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SigningCredentials"></xref> class based on the specified X.509 certificate and security key identifier.

The key identifier clause types supported by Windows Communication Foundation for generating a security key identifier that references an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> are <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause>.

However, in order to enable custom scenarios, this constructor does not perform any validation on the clause types that were used to generate the security key identifier supplied in the `ski` parameter.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SigningCredentials"></xref> class based on the specified X.509 certificate, signature algorithm, and digest algorithm.
By default, this constructor uses an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause> to generate the security key identifier.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SigningCredentials"></xref> class based on the specified X.509 certificate, security key identifier, signature algorithm, and digest algorithm.

The key identifier clause types supported by Windows Communication Foundation for generating a security key identifier that references an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> are <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause>.

However, in order to enable custom scenarios, this constructor does not perform any validation on the clause types that were used to generate the security key identifier supplied in the `ski` parameter.
